Key Arguments: The legislation assumes the population is of low intelligence.
Government control over information removes the public's right to discern truth.
Governments have previously spread misinformation, so they should not be trusted with this power.
The bill could lead to control by future governments, not just the current one.
The legislation is seen as a threat to free speech and democratic values.
Notable Quotes: When Governments step in to control the flow of information the right to decide truth is removed for many.
This bill is a slide towards the type of politics that many immigrants to Australia escaped over the last century.
Free speech is being eroded and will not be viewed kindly by history.
